column1: Explanation: Crosstabs may be useful for the users but they are not desirable in a database system because the queries would get more complicated due to the addition of cross tabs."

column2: The data that have a time interval associated with them during which they are valid are called as  ________

column1: Explanation: The data that have a time interval associated with them during which they are valid are called as Temporal data. We use the term snapshot to mean the value of the data at a particular point in time. "

column2: The value of the data at a particular time is called as?

column1: Explanation: The value of the data at a particular time is called as a snapshot. This is used in temporal data. "

column2: Functional dependencies that have a time associated with them during which they are valid are called as________

column1: Explanation: Functional dependencies that have a time associated with them during which they are valid are called as temporal functional dependencies. All snapshots of the relation should satisfy the functional dependency for it to be a temporal functional dependency. "

column2: State true or false: Overlapping time intervals cannot be prevented

column1: Explanation: IF a system supports a native valid time type, then the system can detect and prevent overlapping time intervals."

column2: Which of the following is the time of temporal data that record when a fact was recorded in a database?

column1: Explanation: The transaction time is the time of temporal data that records when a fact was recorded in a database. "

column2: To specify the foreign keys in relations referencing temporal data we need to specify _______
The Boolean value for the working
The integer corresponding to the relation number

column1: Explanation: To specify the foreign keys in relations referencing temporal data we need to specify the time interval. The time interval specification thus preserves referential integrity in the relation. "

column2: Browsers use a standardized syntax called?

column1: Explanation: The Hypertext Markup Language [HTML] is the standardized syntax used by the browsers which supports formatted information as well as forms based interfaces. "

column2: A ______ is a globally unique name for every document that can be accessed on the Web

column1: Explanation:  A URL (Uniform resource locator) is a globally unique name for every document that can be accessed on the Web."

column2: What is the full form of HTTP?

column1: Explanation: HTTP – Hyper Text Transfer Protocol. This is aprotocol for transferring HTML documents. "

column2: A ______ is a program running on the server which accepts requests from a browser and sends HTML documents

column1: Explanation: A Web Server is a program running on the server which accepts requests from a browser and sends HTML documents. The browser and the web server communicate via HTTP. "

column2: What is the use of CGI?
It specifies the path of data transfer
It specifies how the server communicates with the application programs
It charts out error handling procedures in case an error arises

column1: Explanation: CGI specifies how the server communicates with application programs. The application program communicates with a database server in order to get data. "

column2: The extra information of a site maintained at the client end is called as _______

column1: Explanation: The extra information of a site maintained at the client end is called as cookie. It is a small piece of text containing identifying information with an associated name. "

column2: State true or false: HTTP is connectionless

column1: Explanation: HTTP is connectionless because most computer have a limit on the simultaneous connections they can accommodate. If this limit is exceeded then access is denied to further users. "

column2: What is the full form of CGI?

column1: Explanation: The full form of CGI is Common Gateway Interface. This defines how a web server communicates with an application program. "

column2: Which of the following functions are done by a web server?
Accept requests from a web browser
Executes programs with arguments supplied by the user

column1: Explanation: A web server accepts requests from a web browser and sends back results in HTML. The most important feature of a web server is to execute programs with arguments supplied by the user. "

column2: What is the function of the cascading style sheet
Allows us to edit the HTML document
It is an IDE that allows us to write HTML codes more efficiently
It allows us to use the same style on multiple HTML documents
It acts as an intermediary to provide a variety of information services

column1: Explanation: The cascading style sheet allows us to use the same style sheet on multiple HTML documents allowing us to maintain a distinctive but uniform look on all the pages of a Web site. "

column2: The _______ specification defines an application programming interface for communication between the server and the application program

column1: Explanation: The java servlet specification defines an application programming interface for communication between the server and the application program. The HttpServlet class in Java implements the servlet API specification. "

column2: State true or false: Servlets are used to generate dynamic responses to HTTP requests.

column1: Explanation: Servlets are used to generate dynamic responses to HTTP requests. The task of a servlet is to process a request dynamically. "

column2: Which of these functions is not a part of the servlet lifecycle
Checking if an instance of servlet exists or not
Invoking the service method of the servlet
Pausing the servlet for a given period of time.

column1: Explanation: Pausing the servlet for a given amount of time is not a part of the servlet lifecycle. A servlet can be checked, invoked and destroyed but it cannot be paused. "

column2: Which of the following application servers do not provide built in support for servlets?

column1: Explanation: All of the mentioned application servers provide built in support for servlets. Glassfish and Tomcat are the most prominently used application servers. "

column2: What is the full form of JSP?

column1: Explanation: The full form of JSP is Java Server Pages. It is a scripting language that allows HTML programmers to mix static HTML with dynamically generated HTML. "

column2: While using Javascript, the browser parses the HTML code into a tree like structure defined by a standard called ________

column1: Explanation: While using Javascript, the browser parses the HTML code into a tree like structure defined by a standard called Document Object Model (DOM). Javascript code can modify the tree structure to carry out certain operations. "

column2: Javascript is used to create dynamic webpages using technologies that are collectively called ________

column1: Explanation: Javascript is used to create dynamic webpages using technologies that are collectively called Ajax. "

column2: The programming languages that pre decide the web page content
The programming languages that are simpler and offer same protection
The programming languages that trade off simplicity for protection.

column1: Explanation: Scripting languages are those languages that are simpler with enriched user interface features but offer the same protection as that of Java. "

column2: What are client side scripting languages?
The languages designed to be executed on the client’s web browser
The languages designed to be executed on the server
The languages designed to reduce the amount of data costs incurred at the client end
The languages designed to be executed in multiple computers paralleled with each other

column1: Explanation: Client side scripting languages are those languages that are designed to be executed on the client’s web browser. These languages provide constructs that can be embedded with an HTML document. "

column2: State true or false: Executing programs at the client side is slower than executing programs on the server

column1: Explanation: Executing programs on the client side is faster than executing programs on the server which includes sending every interaction to the server. "

column2: Which of the following is true regarding the model-view- controller architecture?
The model corresponds to the business logic layer
The view defines the presentation of data
The controller receives events, executes actions on the model and returns a view

column1: Explanation: In the model-view-controller architecture, the model corresponds to the business logic layer, the view defines the way data is presented and the controller receives events, executes actions on the model and returns a view. "

column2: The ___________ provides a high level view of data and actions on data

column1: Explanation: The Business-logic layer provides a high level view of data and actions on data. An object oriented approach is used to code this layer. "

column2: The _________ layer provides the interface between the business logic layer and the underlying database

column1: Explanation: The data-access layer provides the interface between the business logic layer and the underlying database. The data access layer provides the mapping from the object oriented data model to the relational model. "

column2: What are workflows in a business logic layer?
They describe how a particular task that involves servers is handled
They describe how multiple tasks involving a single participant is handled
They describe how a particular task involving multiple participants is handled.

column1: Explanation: Business logic includes workflows. Workflows in a business logic layer describe how a particular task involving multiple participants is handled. "

column2: State true or false: The code implementing the actions in the business logic layer ensures that business rules are followed

column1: Explanation: The code implementing the actions in the business logic layer ensures that business rules are followed. For example a student can only enroll in a course if the prerequisites are completed. "

column2: What is the full form of JSON?

column1: Explanation: JSON – JavaScript Object Notation. This is an encoding for javascript objects. "

column2: Which of the following features does Rapid Application Development possess?
Provide a library of functions to generate UI elements
Provide drag and drop features in a n IDE
Auto generation of code for the user interface from a declarative specification

column1: Explanation: The main features of Rapid Application development are to provide a library of functions for GUI development, to provide drag and drop features in an IDE, Auto-generation of code for the user interface from a declarative specification. "

column2: Which of the following is not a web application development framework feature?
A declarative way of specifying a form with validation constraints
Creating mass servers for effective handling of data

column1: Explanation: Creating mass servers for effective handling of data is not a part of the web application development framework feature. "

column2: They are the tools to generate human readable reports from a database
They are the tools that generate reports on the statistics of the database usage
They are the tools that prevent database querying and instead they generate pie charts and graphs

column1: Explanation: Report generators are the tools to generate human readable reports from a database. They integrate querying the database with the creation of formatted text and summary charts. "

column2: Which of the following methods is used to reduce overhead?
Caching Query Results at the server

column1: Explanation: To reduce overhead, any of the following methods can be used. Connection pooling, Parallel processing or caching query results at the server. Caching query results at the server enables to reduce the number of database accesses every time a similar request is sent. "

column2: If an attacker manages to get an application to execute an SQL query created by the attacker, then such attacks are called as _________

column1: Explanation: If an attacker manages to get an application to execute an SQL query created by the attacker, then such attacks are called as SQL injection attacks. "

column2: An attack on a website that stores and displays text to a user is known as ______ attack

column1: Explanation: An attack on a website that stores and displays text to a user is known as XSS attack. It is called as cross site scripting attack. "

column2: The URL of the page that had the link that the user clicked to access the page is called as _____

column1: Explanation: The URL of the page that had the link that the user clicked to access the page is called as referrer. The HTTP protocol allows the server to check the referrer. "

column2: State true or false: Password leakage is a major security problem

column1: Explanation: Password leakage is a major security problem because the leaked password grants access to malicious visitors. "

column2: The system where two independent pieces of data are used to identify a user is called as ______

column1: Explanation: The system where two independent pieces of data are used to identify a user is called as two-factor authentication. The two factors should not share a common vulnerability. "

column2: What are man in the middle attacks?
Users are forced to use a second server which causes the attack
Users are forced to divert to a fake site where the attack takes place
Users are fooled by similar GUI and data is extracted from them.

column1: Explanation: Man in the middle attacks are those attacks in which the users are forced to divert to a fake site where the attack takes place. The fake site is then used to obtain the data from the user. "

column2: Users are forced to use a second server which causes the attack
Users are forced to divert to a fake site where the attack takes place
Users are fooled by similar GUI and data is extracted from them.

column1: Explanation: Phishing attacks are those attacks in which users are fooled by similar GUI and data is extracted from them. The fake site is then used to obtain the data from the user. "

column2: What is the standard for exchanging authentication and authorization information between two different security domains?

column1: Explanation: SAML (Security assertion Markup Language) is the standard for exchanging authentication and authorization information between two different security domains. This provides a cross-organization sign-on. "

column2: A log of all changes to the application data is called as __________

column1: Explanation: A log of all changes to the application data is called as audit trail. This helps us maintain security as it tracks all the breaches on the system. "

column2: Which of the following is a valid encryption technique?

column1: Explanation: Out of the given options, only public key encryption is a valid approach to an encryption technique. In this, there are two different keys to encrypt the data. "

column2: Statement 1: Cache storage is very fast

column1: Statement 2: Cache storage is very cheap

column2: Statement 1 is true but statement 2 is false
Statement 1 is false but statement 2 is true

column1: Explanation: Cache storage is very fast but it is the costliest form of storage. "

column2: What is the difference between flash memory and main memory?
Data is retained in flash memory
Data access is faster in flash memory
Data storage is very large in flash memory

column1: Explanation: Data is retained in flash memory. Power losses do not affect the data stored in flash memory."

column2: What is the full form of USB?

column1: Explanation: USB – Universal Serial Bus. This is currently the most popular and convenient way of data transmittal. "

column2: DVD is a form of ______ storage

column1: Explanation: DVD is a form of optical storage. The data on a DVD is read by an optical reader. "

column2: Which of the following is a part of the Magnetic disk assembly?

column1: Explanation: In a magnetic disk assembly, Spindle is the central cylindrical rod, Read write head is used to read and write data and the arm is used to hold the magnetic disk. "

column2: When a large number of disks are connected by a high speed network to a number of server computers, it is known as ________ architecture

column1: Explanation: When a large number of disks are connected by a high speed network to a number of server computers, it is known as Storage Area Network (SAN) architecture. These disks are usually arranged by a local organization technique called RAID. "

column2: The time from when a read or write request is issued to when the actual data transfer begins is called _______

column1: Explanation: The time from when a read or write request is issued to when the actual data transfer begins is called access time. Data transfer rate is the rate at which data can be retrieved from the storage. "

column2: The time for repositioning the arm is called as _________

column1: Explanation: The time for repositioning the arm is called as Seek time."

column2: Which of the following is a measure of reliability of a disk?

column1: Explanation: The mean time to failure is the measure of the reliability of a disk. It gives the mean of the times that most disks last. "

column2: The blocks read from disk are directly accessed
The blocks read from disk are temporarily stored in a memory
The blocks read from disk are organized in a particular fashion to cater requests.

column1: Explanation: Buffering involves reading the data and storing it in a temporary memory location called as the data buffer for future requests. The data in the buffer is temporary and is deleted after usage. "

column2: RAM which is non-volatile in nature
RAM whose data is not lost during power failures
RAM that significantly speeds up data transfers

column1: Explanation: A non-volatile random access memory or NVRAM is the one which is non-volatile, data is retained during power failure and which considerably speeds up the disk writes."

column2: Files that support log disks are called as ________

column1: Explanation: Files that support log disks are called as Journaling File Systems. Journaling file systems can be implemented without a separate log disk, keeping the data and the log on the same disk. "

column2: State true or false: NOR flash is cheaper than NAND flash

column1: Explanation: NAND flash is significantly cheaper than NOR flash and also has a higher storage capacity and hence is widely used."

column2: The logical to physical page mapping is represented in a ____________

column1: Explanation: The logical to physical page mapping is represented in a Transition table which is generally available in memory. This is used for quick access of data. "

column2: What is the full form of RAID?

column1: Explanation: The full form of RAID is Redundant array of Independent Disks. This disk organization technique improves performance and reliability. "

column2: The process of duplicating every disk is called _______

column1: Explanation: The simplest technique to introduce redundancy is to duplicate every disk. This process is known as Mirroring."

column2: State true or false: Using RAID increases the mean time to failure

column1: Explanation: Using RAID enables us to use multiple disks which when combined together increase the mean time to failure. "

column2: Data striping by splitting bits across multiple disks is called as _______

column1: Explanation:  Data striping by splitting bits across multiple disks is called as bit level striping. For example if we have an array of 8 disks, we write bit I of each byte to disk i. "

column2: How many levels of RAID exist?

column1: Explanation: There exist a total of 7 RAID levels ranging from 0 to 6."

column2: Disk arrays with striping at the level of blocks

column1: Explanation: RAID level 0 refers to Disk arrays with striping at the level of blocks. This level does not have any redundancy. "

column2: Disk arrays with striping at the level of blocks

column1: Explanation: RAID level 1 refers to Disk mirroring with block striping. This is also called as RAID 10 or RAID 1+0. "

column2: Disk arrays with striping at the level of blocks

column1: Explanation: RAID level 2 refers to Memory style error correcting code. Memory systems have long parity bits for error detection and correction. "

column2: Disk arrays with striping at the level of blocks

column1: Explanation: RAID level 5 refers to Block interleaved distributed parity. It partitions both the data and parity among N+1 disks. "

column2: Which of the factors need not be taken into consideration while choosing a RAID level?
Performance when the disk has failed

column1: Explanation: Monetary cost, I/O requirements, performance when disk has failed are to be taken into consideration while choosing a RAID level. "

column2: What is the approximate storage capacity of CDs in MB

column1: Explanations: CDs generally have a storage capacity of 700 Megabytes and DVDs have a storage capacity of around 4.7 Gigabytes."

column2: The devices that store a lot of optical disks are called as

column1: Explanation: Jukeboxes are the devices that store a lot of optical disks and load them automatically on demand. "

column2: Which of the following is true about file header?
It is allocated at the beginning of the file
It has information about the file
It generally contains the address of the first record in it

column1: Explanation: A file header is a certain number of bytes allocated at the beginning of the file. It contains a variety of information about the file and it can be used to point the first record by storing the address of the first record in it."

column2: How can variable length records arise in a file
Storage of multiple record types in a file
Record types that allow variable lengths for one or more fields
Record types that allow repeating fields, such as arrays or multisets

column1: Explanation: Variable length records arise in a system in several ways like, Storage of multiple record types in a file. Record types that allow variable lengths for one or more fields. Record types that allow repeating fields, such as arrays or multisets. "

column2: What does a null bitmap indicate?
The attributes of a record do not have a value
The attributes are missing from record

column1: Explanation: A null-bitmap indicates that the attributes of a particular record have null values. "

column2: State true or False: Variable length records cannot be implemented

column1: Explanation: Variable length records can be implemented in databases. There are different techniques to implement variable length records. "

column2: The linked list formed by the deleted records is called as ______

column1: Explanation: As the addresses can be thought of as pointers, the deleted records thus form a linked list. The linked list formed by the deleted records is called as a free list. "

column2: The slotted page structure is used for _________

column1: Explanation: The slotted page structure is used for organizing records in a block. The slotted page structure contains a header at the beginning of each block. "

column2: The header in the slotted page structure does not contain which of the following data?
The number of record entries in the header
The end of free space in a block
The size of all the records put together in the header
An array containing location and size of each record

column1: Explanation: The header in the slotted page structure does not contain the size of all the records put together in the header but it contains the number of record entries, the end of free space and an array containing location and size of each record. "

column2: State true or false: It is easier to delete a record from the fixed length records

column1: Explanation: It is tough to delete a record from the fixed length records but it is easier to delete a record from the variable length record. Thus, implementation of variable records is preferred. "

column2: Any record can be placed wherever there is a space for the record
Records are stored in a sequential order according to a search key
A hash function is computed on some attribute and that decides the block

column1: Explanation: Heap file organization means that any record can be placed wherever there is space for that record. There is no ordering of records. Typically there is a single file for each relation. "

column2: Any record can be placed wherever there is a space for the record
Records are stored in a sequential order according to a search key
A hash function is computed on some attribute and that decides the block

column1: Explanation: Sequential file organization means that Records are stored in a sequential order according to a search key. The records are ordered. "

column2: Any record can be placed wherever there is a space for the record
Records are stored in a sequential order according to a search key
A hash function is computed on some attribute and that decides the block

column1: Explanation: Hashing file organization means that a hash function is computed on some attribute and that decides the block. The result of the hash function specifies which block of the file the record should be placed in. "

column2: What is a search key in sequential file organization?
A number assigned to each record
Any attribute or a set of attributes

column1: Explanation: A search key in sequential file organization is any attribute or a set of attributes that need not be a primary key or even a superkey. "

column2: Metadata about the relations are stored in ________

column1: Explanation: A relational schema needs to maintain data about the data called as metadata. Metadata about the relations is stored in the Data dictionary."

column2: Data dictionary is also called as ________

column1: Explanation: Data dictionary is also called as System Catalog. "

column2: What is a multitable clustering file organization?
It stores related records of two or more relations in each block
It stores related data about the relations in each block
It links each and every block by introducing an external attribute

column1: Explanation: A multitable clustering file organization stores the related records of two or more relations in each block. This allows us to read records that satisfy a join condition by using one block read. "

column2: Which of the following need to be stored in the data dictionary?

column1: Explanation: Name of the relation, Domains and lengths of attributes and Integrity constraints all must be stored in the data dictionary."

column2: The subsystem responsible for the allocation of buffer space is called as _______

column1: Explanation: The subsystem responsible for the allocation of buffer space is called as buffer manager. Programs on the database make requests to the buffer manager and it in in turn allocates the buffer space. "

column2: What is the full form of LRU (in buffer replacement strategy)?

column1: Explanation: The full form of LRU is Least Recently Used. In this, the least recently used program is substituted by the new request. "

column2: The types of access that are supported efficiently are called as ________

column1: Explanation: The types of access that are supported efficiently are called as Access types. Access types can include finding records with a specified attribute value or within a particular range."

column2: The time it takes to find a particular data item is called as ___________

column1: Explanation: The time it takes to find a particular data item or a set of data items using the technique in question is called as access time."

column2: The time it takes to insert a new data item is called ____________

column1: Explanation: The time it takes to insert a new data item is called Insertion time. This value includes the time taken to find the correct place to insert the new data item as well as the time it takes to update the index structure."

column2: The time it takes to delete a data item is called as _________

column1: Explanation: The time it takes to delete a data item is called as deletion time. This value includes finding the item to be deleted and the time taken to update the index structure."

column2: The additional space occupied by an index structure is called as _________

column1: Explanation: The additional space occupied by an index structure is called as space overhead. It is usually a worthwhile sacrifice to achieve improved performance."

column2: If the file containing the records is sequentially ordered, a ___________ is an index whose search key also defines the sequential order of the file.

column1: Explanation: If the file containing the records is sequentially ordered, a Clustering index is an index whose search key also defines the sequential order of the file. Clustering indices are also called as primary indices but they do not denote an index on the primary key. Such indices can be built on any search key."

column2: State true or false: Clustering indices are also called as primary indices

column1: Explanation: If the file containing the records is sequentially ordered, a Clustering index is an index whose search key also defines the sequential order of the file. Clustering indices are also called as primary indices."

column2: If an index entry appears for every search key value in the file, it is called as ________

column1: Explanation: In a dense index, an index entry appears for every search key value in the file. In a dense clustering index, the index record contains the search-key value and a pointer to the first data record with that search-key value."

column2: If an index entry appears for only some of the search key values in the file, it is called as ________

column1: Explanation: In a sparse index, an index entry appears for only some of the search key values. Sparse indices can be used only if the relation is stored in the sorted order of the search key i.e. if the index is a clustering index."

column2: Indices with two or more levels are called as?

column1: Explanation: Indices with two or more levels are called as multilevel indices. They require significantly few I/O operations than searching using binary search."

column2: A search key containing more than one attribute is called a _________ search key

column1: Explanation: A search key containing more than one attribute is called as a composite search key. The structure of the index is the same as that of any other index, the only difference being that it is not a single search attribute but a list of attributes."

column2: State true or false: B+ trees are not always balanced trees.

column1: Explanation: B+ trees are always balanced. Every path from the root to the leaf of the tree is of the same length. "

column2: What are the leaf nodes in a B+ tree?
The nodes in between the top and bottom nodes

column1: Explanation: The bottommost nodes that mark the end of a tree are known as the leaf nodes in a B+ tree."

column2: Non-leaf nodes are also called as __________

column1: Explanation: Non leaf nodes are also known as internal nodes. A non-leaf node may hold up to n pointers and should hold at least n/2 pointers. "

column2: The queries used to find all records with search key values in a particular range are known as ________

column1: Explanation: The queries used to find all records with search key values in a particular range are known as Range queries. These type of queries are executed using procedures. "

column2: Statement 1: Insertion of record might require the change in position of the initial nodes.

column1: Statement 2: Deletion of records might require the change in position of the initial nodes.

column2: Statement 1 is true but statement 2 is false
Statement 2 is true but statement 1 is false

column1: Explanation: Both insertion and deletion of records might require the change in position of the initial nodes because the new data value might not exactly fit into the B+ tree. Thus rotation of the nodes is generally required. "

column2: If a relation can have more than one record containing the same search key value, the search key is said to be a __________

column1: Explanation: If a relation can have more than one record containing the same search key value, the search key is said to be a non-unique search key. A problem with non-unique search keys is inefficiency during delete operations. "

column2: State true or false: The fanout of nodes can be increased by using a technique called _________

column1: Explanation: The fanout of nodes can be increased by using a technique called prefix compression. In this, we do not store the entire value of the search key at the node. We only store the prefix of the search key. "

column2: Insertion of a large number of entries at a time into an index is referred to as _______ of the index.

column1: Explanation: Insertion of a large number of entries at a time into an index is referred to as bulk loading of the index. This reduces the time complexity as multiple entries are loaded at the same time. "

column2: ___________ are the indices that store the values of some attributes along with the pointers to the recor.

column1: Explanation: Covering indices are the indices that store the values of some attributes along with the pointers to the record. Storing extra attribute values is useful as they allow us to Answer queries without actually looking up the records. "

column2: The term ______ is used to denote a unit of storage that can store one or more records

column1: Explanation: The term bucket is used to denote a unit of storage that can store one or more records. A bucket is typically a disk block but it can also be larger than a disk block. "

column2: If K denotes the set of all the search key values, and B denotes the set of all bucket addresses, a function from K to B is called as __________

column1: Explanation: If K denotes the set of all the search key values, and B denotes the set of all bucket addresses, a function h from K to B is called as the hash function. It determines which bucket should contain the data in question. "

column2: In a __________ , we obtain the address of the disk block containing a desired record directly by computing a function on the search key value of the record

column1: Explanation: Hashing can be used for 2 different purposes, hash file organization and hash index organization. In a Hash file organization, we obtain the address of the disk block containing a desired record directly by computing a function on the search key value of the record. "

column2: In a __________ we organize the search keys, with their associated pointers, into a hash file structure

column1: Explanation: Hashing can be used for 2 different purposes, hash file organization and hash index organization. In a hash index organization, we organize the search keys, with their associated pointers, into a hash file structure."

column2: When a bucket does not have enough space

column1: Explanation: Bucket overflow can occur in many ways. When a bucket does not have enough space, there are insufficient buckets, when a bucket skew occurs. "

column2: Some buckets are assigned more records than the others which causes bucket overflow, this condition is called as ________

column1: Explanation: Some buckets are assigned more records than the others which causes bucket overflow, this condition is called as Bucket skew. Skew occurs if multiple records have the same search key or if the given hash function is non uniform. "

column2: Overflow handling using a linked list of buckets is called as ____________

column1: Explanation: All the overflow buckets are chained together in a linked list. Overflow handling using a linked list of buckets is called as Overflow chaining."

column2: State true or false: A hash index organizes the search keys, with their associated pointers, into a hash file structure

column1: Explanation: A hash index organizes the search keys, with their associated pointers, into a hash file structure. We can construct a hash index by applying a hash function on a search key and store the key and its associated pointers in the bucket. "

column2: Which of the following is the worst hash function among the given choices
The sum of the digits modulo 8
The sum of the digits modulo 2
The sum of the digits modulo 5
